title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that ESM Bank’s liabilities will stay the same and/or does not explain that the transaction only affects the asset side of ESM Bank’s balance sheet by increasing ESM Bank’s reserves and decreasing ESM Bank’s holdings of bonds by the same amount, leaving the liabilities of ESM Bank unchanged.

The response states that ESM Bank’s liabilities will stay the same and explains that the transaction only affects the asset side of ESM Bank’s balance sheet by increasing ESM Bank’s reserves and decreasing ESM Bank’s holdings of bonds by the same amount, leaving the liabilities of ESM Bank unchanged.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that ESM Bank’s reserves will increase by $10,000 and/or does not explain that reserves will increase by the full amount of the bond purchase because ESM Bank traded bonds for cash or reserves (or because this transaction increases ESM Bank’s excess reserves which increases ESM Bank’s reserves; required reserves did not change).

The response states that ESM Bank’s reserves will increase by $10,000 and explains that reserves will increase by the full amount of the bond purchase because ESM Bank traded bonds for cash or reserves (or because this transaction increases ESM Bank’s excess reserves which increases ESM Bank’s reserves; required reserves did not change).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the dollar value of the maximum amount of loans ESM Bank can make is $10,000 and/or does not explain that ESM Bank can lend out its excess reserves and the central bank’s purchase increased ESM Bank’s excess reserves by $10,000.

The response states that the dollar value of the maximum amount of loans ESM Bank can make is $10,000 and explains that ESM Bank can lend out its excess reserves and the central bank’s purchase increased ESM Bank’s excess reserves by $10,000.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $40,000 and/or does not show the work.

The response calculates the maximum amount by which the money supply can increase throughout the banking system as $40,000 and shows the work.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that consumption spending and real GDP will increase and/or does not explain that the increase in the money supply decreases nominal interest rates and increases interest-sensitive spending, including consumption, thus increasing aggregate demand and real GDP.

The response states that consumption spending and real GDP will increase and explains that the increase in the money supply decreases nominal interest rates and increases interest-sensitive spending, including consumption, thus increasing aggregate demand and real GDP.
